Today we enact a law that speeds up and reduces deadlines for courts to receive and hear the collective demands of consumers.
So far, the period for admitting class actions is between 2 and 4 years. With the new law we hope that this term will be reduced to 6 months.
In addition this law establishes that the judge should try to conciliate the parties, if there is no agreement then there will be an expeditious trial.
Our Government will never remain indifferent to abuses against consumers and will protect them with all legal means.
